RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Bacharelado em Fsica pela Universidade Estadual de Londrina (1983), mestrado em Fsica pelo Instituto de Fsica Gleb Wataghin (1986) e doutorado em Fsica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1998). Atualmente pesquisador titular - Comando Geral de Tecnologia Aeroespacial. Atualmente Pesquisador Titular do Instituto de Estudos Avanados - IEAv. Tem experincia na rea de Fsica, com nfase em ptica e Espectroscopia Atmica, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Laser, Laser de Vapor de Cobre, Laser de Corante, Fibra ptica, Sistemas de Transporte e Manipulao de Feixes usado Fibra ptica, Separao Isotpica a Laser (AVLIS), Espectroscopia Optogalvnica e Espectroscopia Multifotonica de Fotoionizacao.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Bacharelado em Fsica from Universidade Estadual de Londrina (1983), master's at Physic from Instituto de Fsica Gleb Wataghin (1986) and ph.d. at Physic from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1998). Has experience in Physic, focusing on Optics, acting on the following subjects: uranium, hollow-cathode lamp, urnio, espectroscopia optogalvnica and photoionization spectroscopy.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Por reorganizao do Comando da Aeronutica, o Centro Tcnico Aeroespacial deixou de existir e o Instituto de Estudos Avanados passou a ser uma Organizao Militar independente. O vnculo profissional passa a ser, de 2007 em diante, diretamente com o Instituto de Estudos Avanados.

At Dezembro de 2006 o Instituto de Estudos Avanados era um rgo vinculado ao Centro Tcnico Aeroespacial (CTA). Com a reorganizao do Comando da Aeronutica, em janeiro de 2007 o CTA deixa de existir e o Instituto de Estudos Avanados passa a ser uma Organizao Militar autnoma.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Estudos e experimentos sobre separao de istopos de urnio por lasers vm sendo desenvolvidos no Instituto de Estudos Avanados (IEAv), do Centro Tcnico Aeroespacial (CTA), desde sua fundao em 1981. Estes tm por objetivo a demonstrao da viabilidade deste processo usando, sempre que possvel, os recursos disponveis no nosso Pas. Dentro desta Linha de Pesquisa tenho estado envolvido nas seguintes atividades: (i) espectroscopia optogalvnica em lmpadas de catodo oco operando em regime de descarga eltrica contnua ou pulsada; (ii) espectroscopia multifotnica e de fotoionizao em vapores metlico de urnio. A partir de 2005 uma nova atividade de pesquisa passou a ser desenvolvida com o intuto de estender a capacitao obtida, na conduo dos experimentos sobre separao de istopos de urnio por lasers, a outros materiais de interesse aeroespacial como, por exemplo, terras raras e istopos estveis de refratrios.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Implantao de procedimentos e realizao de experimentos de espectroscopia optogalvnica e de fotoionizao seletiva a laser em istopos de terras-raras. Adequao da infra-estrutura existente em nossos laboratrios de separao isotpica a laser de vapor atmico de urnio na implementao do processo de fotoionizao seletiva a laser em istopos de terras-raras.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PASIL - Processo Atmico de Separao Isotpica via Lasers
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto PASIL - Processo Atmico de Separao Isotpica a Laser - consiste em aplicar as tcnicas de separao de istopos desenvolvidas no IEAv para o enriquecimento de urnio, na separao de terras raras, de interesse em aplicaes aeroespaicias. So realizados estudos de evaporao por ablao a laser, de espctrocopia de fotoionizao e de coleta de materiai fotoionizado.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: PASIL - Processo Atmico de Separao Isotpica via Lasers

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Processo Atmico de Separao Isotpica via Lasers de Urnio
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O urnio natural composto majoritariamente de dois istopos, 238U e o 235U, a propores de 99,3% e 0,7%, respectivamente. Para sua utilizao como combustvel nuclear, necessrio elevar a proporo de 235U (enriquecer o U) a pelo menos 3%. A essncia do projeto Separao de Istopos - Processo Atmico consiste basicamente em enriquecer U atravs da excitao seletiva do 235U, utilizando-se da interao de lasers com vapor de U atmico. Este processo possvel visto que o 235U e o 238U absorvem radiao eletromagntica em freqncias diferentes. - O ciclo completo descrito a seguir: vapor de U natural produzido atravs de um bombardeamento de U metlico, em uma cmara de vcuo, por um canho de eltrons, o vapor assim gerado iluminado por feixes de lasers com freqncias de emisso escolhidas de modo que somente o 235U seja excitado e posteriormente ionizado, por absoro multipassos de luz; finalmente os ons gerados so extrados do vapor por coletores polarizados por campo eltrico.

Para sua utilizao como combustvel nuclear, necessrio elevar a proporo de 235U (enriquecer o U) a pelo menos 3%. A essncia do projeto Separao de Istopos - Processo Atmico consiste basicamente em enriquecer U atravs da excitao seletiva do 235U, utilizando-se da interao de lasers com vapor de U atmico. LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: O principal objetivo desta linha de pesquisa o desenvolvimento de dispositivos e instrumentaes pticas auxiliares para a conduo dos projetos dentros das linhas pesquisas de laser e de separao istpicas a laser. Dentre os dispositivos pticos que so objetos de estudos dentro desta lionha de pesquisaas podem ser destacados: (i) os conformadores de feixes usados para homogeneizar o perfil de intensidades de feixes de lasers, que so utilizados tanto com sistemas de bombeamento homogneo de laser de corante como em aplicaes na reas de processamento de material; (ii) sistema de transporte e manipulao de feixes de alta potncia de lasers visveis (alguns MW/pulso), usando fibra ptica de 200 a 1000 micrometros de dimetro do ncleo; (iii) combinadores a fibra ptic de feixes de lasers com diferentes comprimentos de ondas para serem aplicados nos processos de separao istpicas a laser entre outros dispositivos pticos. Dentre as instrumentaes pticas sabido que tanto a qualidade de um feixe de laser, como a estabilidade de sintonia e a largura de linha laser, como a temperatura de corpos incandescentes, entre outros parmetros fsicos de interesse, podem ser monitorados por meio de processamento de imagem.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Laboratrio Multiusurio de Desenvolvimento de Aplicaes de Laser e ptica - DedALO
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Embora o DedALO esteja em operao h dois anos, ele no foi completamente operacionalizado ainda, funcionando em alguns aspectos, em carter precrio, como: cilindros de gases de processos instalados no interior do laboratrio; vapores de fumos removidos usando aspiradores de p comerciais; mesas XY e lineares de controle de posio e velocidade de processos fixadas em bancadas pticas ou em macacos de laboratrios, inadequados para materiais pesados em altas velocidades; caracterizao dos materiais processados a laser feitos em laboratrios distantes do DedALO; e , finalmente, h a necessidade de software para desenhos de formas e geometrias para desenvolvimento de processos. O objetivo dessa proposta, ento, terminar a instrumentao do DedALO para desenvolvimento de aplicaes de lasers e ptica usando lasers de baixa e mdia potncia.

O projeto consiste basicamente em especificar, adquirir, instalar e adequar fontes laser e a instrumentao auxiliar necessria para operacionalizar os laboratrios de lasers vinculados nossa linha de pesquisa principal, Lasers. Este pretende contemplar tambm outras atividades de pesquisa e desenvolvimento como o processamento de materiais, ptica no linear e espectroscopia, bem como outras reas de interesse aeroespacial. AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Processos de Coliso e Interaes de tomos e Molculas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Two-photon optogalvanic spectroscopy technique was used to measure the lifetime of the first excited state of uranium atoms contained in a hollow cathode discharge. This was accomplished from measurements of the optogalvanic signal magnitude as a function of the time delay between two laser pulses. Preliminary results were obtained using this technique to the uranium 7M7 excited level.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: SEPARATING URANIUM BY LASER: THE ATOMIC PROCESS

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Espectros Atmicos e Integrao de Ftons

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Among the countries around the world that utilizes nuclear energy, several ones are investing significantly in the development of laser techniques applied to isotope separation. In Brazil these studies are concentrated in one research institute, the IEAv (Institute for Advanced Studies), and aim at demonstrating the viability of this process using, as much as possible, resources available in the country. In this paper we briefly describe the laser methods for isotope separation, giving an overview of the present research and development status in this area. We also show some results obtained in our laboratories. We focused this report on the atomic route for laser isotope separation, mainly in the areas of laser development and spectroscopy.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper describes the assessment of a pulsed hollow cathode lamp for photoionization spectroscopy. The hollow cathode lamp is driven by an electric circuit that pulses the discharge and allows electric current measurements in the afterglow. Ions of uranium were produced through sequencial absorption of three photons from tunable dye lasers pumped by copper vapor lasers. The dye lasers were tuned in order to match different absorption sequences.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste trabalho descrevem-se experimentos realizados em uma Lampada de Catodo Oco de Uranio com Descarga Pulsada com o objetivo de se obter uma fonte de vapor metalico para uso em espectroscopia de fotoionizacao. O vapor de uranio e gerado por uma descarga eletrica pulsada, e medidas de corrente eletrica sao realizadas no pos- descarga (afterglow). Ions de uranio sao produzidos usando um esquema de fotoionizacao por absorcao sequencial de tres fotons de dois comprimentos de onda, gerados por laseres de corante bombeados por laseres de vapor de cobre. O tempo de decaimento do sinal de fotoionizacao foi atribuido a difusao de ions de uranio para parede do catodo.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: ESPECTROSCOPIA DE FOTOIONIZACAO EM LAMPADA DE CATODO OCO DE DESCARGA PULSADA

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Espectros Atmicos e Integrao de Ftons

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The hollow cathode lamp is a powerful tool that allows the study of one or two photons absorption in U atoms through the optogalvanic spectroscopy. However, the observation of the third photon absorption, that usually leads to photoionization, is screened either by collisions with the buffer gas or, mainly, by collisions with electrons in the electric discharge. We performed a series of experiments to verify if it is possible to observe photoionization of U atoms in the afterglow of a pulsed hollow cathode lamp, i.e., pulsing a hollow cathode lamp and trying to observe photoionization signals after the electric discharge is off. The basic experimental setup consists on a conventional hollow U cathode lamp attached to a circuit that allows both the pulsed operation and the monitoring of electric currents in the period when the electric discharge is off. Using a very well known two-photons photoionization sequence (5915 and 6051 ) it was possible to observe photoionization signal in the afterglow period. Using the photoionization signal to monitor the ground state U vapor density, it was verified that the U vapor can last more than 1 ms after the electric discharge is off in the cathode region. There are indications that this long U vapor lifetime is due to clusters formation. Measurements of the time that the U vapor remains in the cathode region indicated that about 17% of the ground state U is photoionized in every laser shot (the two lasers fired simultaneously).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A tecnica de medida de tempos. de vida via espectroscopia optogalvanica e estudada, utilizando-se de um modelo numerico, baseado em equacoes de taxa, visando avaliar a influencia da duracao dos pulsos de laser nos resultados obtidos. E observado que mesmo quando a duracao dos pulsos de laser e comparavel com o tempo de vida da transicao a ser estudada, pode-se inferir os resultados com razoavel precisao.
Relatrio de Pesquisa IEAv RP 011/95 (Jun95).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A espectroscopia optogalvanica pode ser usada para fornecer informacoes diretas muito uteis na identificacao de niveis de altas energias, medidas de deslocamento isotopico, estruturas finas e hiperfinas, etc., porem devem-se tomar cuidados especiais na utilizacao de seus resultados para se determinar a forma e a largura de linha das transicoes envolvidas. Neste trabalho utilizamos e descrevemos a tecnica de espectroscopia optogalvanica de dois fotons para medir o tempo de vida do primeiro nivel excitado do uranio. Para tal, sao realizadas medidas do atraso entre os pulsos de laseres utilizados em funcao da corrente de operacao da lampada de catodo oco de uranio. Alem disso, apresentamos e discutimos os resultados preliminares obtidos para o nivel 7M7 do uranio, usando tal tecnica.
RELATORIO DE PESQUISA IEAV RP 010/95 (1995)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: UTILIZACAO DE LAMPADAS DE CATODO OCO DE OXIDO DE URANIO EM ESPECTROSCOPIA OPTOGALVANICA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste trabalho e discutido a utilizacao de lampadas de catodo oco de oxido de uranio em espectroscopia optogalvanica. Estas lampadas sao mais comumente desenvolvidas com uranio metalico. Em experimentos de separacao isotopica de uranio, nos quais estas lampadas podem ser utilizadas, um laser de corante e sintonizado nas transicoes eletronicas do atomo do isotopo 235U. Devido a dificuldade de se obter uranio metalico e pelo fato de ser mais facil obter o U30~, construimos uma lampada de catodo oco deste oxido. Sao apresentados os resultados das experiencias onde sao comparados os espectros de emissao e sinal optogalvanico de lampadas construidas com uranio metalico e oxido de uranio. Estes mostram a inviabilidade da utilizacao de lampadas oxido de uranio na espectroscopia optogalvanica.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: DETECCAO SIMULTANEA DOS SINAIS OPTOGALVANICO E DE FOTOIONIZACAO A MULTIPLOS PASSO PARA O URANIO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Desde que seja possivel descrever o sinal optogalvanico em funcao do fluxo de fotons incidentes, e possivel, em principio, determinar a intensidade de saturacao da transicao envolvida a partir de medidas experimentais do sinal optogalvanico em funcao do numero de fotons incidentes. Contudo, devido a alta diversidade de niveis de energia que ocorrem em atomos pesados, tais como o uranio, transicoes multifotonicas podem facilmente ocorrer e complicar a interpretacao dos efeitos de saturacao bem como a compreensao dos espectros obtidos a partir de medidas simultaneas dos sinais optogalvanicos e de fotoionizacao a multiplos passos mostra-se que ocorre uma transicao multifotonica para a transicao 5915,9 do uranio.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Atomic Vapor Laser Isotope Separation (AVLIS) project, in development in the Instituto de Estudos Avanados, IEAv, demands extensive studies of multi-step, multi-frequencies photoionization spectroscopy in metallic U. These studies have been done using U hollow cathode lamp at IEAv. The hollow cathode lamp is a very versatile, compact, simple and reliable tool to provide metal vapor for spectroscopic purposes. It basically consists on a hollow cathode electric discharge cell with optical windows to allow the passage of light either from the discharge to the outside or from an external light source into the discharge region. Collisions of discharge ions with cathode walls can provide a dense vapor of the cathode material. The cathode materialabsorption spectrum can be obtained by illuminating the discharge with the beam of a tunable laser and monitoring the optogalvanic signal versus laser wavelength. However, there are physical parameters, important to the AVLIS, that changes if the U vapor is produced in a hollow cathode lamp or in a vacuum furnace, mainly due to colisional processes. By studying the effects of the collisions with electrons and neutral atom on the effective lifetime of the 7M7 level, it was observed that it is impossible to obtain colisional parameters in the hollow cathode discharge lamp. This paper presents the experimental investigation of the U-Ar and U-electrons Collisions rates using the effective lifetime measurements of the 7M7 uranium level obtained from optogalvanic signal in a hollow cathode lamp working with a DC discharge as a technique to obtain the colisional parameters. The experimental results compares well with theoretical values obtained using models found in literature.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work we derive the invariant parameter of the hollow cathode discharge, which is associated with the current density using the similarity relations. The discharge voltage was plotted as a function of the parameter l J/p using the experimental data measured in different discharges. Two hollow cathode discharges in argon with cathodes made of copper and uranium were used. In both cases the experimental points follow a single curve which can be denominated the discharge characteristic, showing, thus, that l J/p is really an invariant parameter.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the results of photoionization spectroscopy, performed in the afterglow of a pulsed uranium hollow cathode lamp. Three pulsed dye lasers pumped by copper vapor lasers were used to produce the photoionization. The hollow cathode lamp was driven by a pulsed electric circuit that allowed uranium vapor production through sputtering, and the observation of electric charge formation in the afterglow. Either single, two and three frequencies photoionization were studied in the range between 5900 and 6060 by illuminating the discharge lamp with single, two and three laser beams. The results with single and two frequencies compared quite well with the literature. A three frequencies photoionization spectrum is shown, with the first and second laser fixed to 5915 and 6016 , and with the third laser with the frequency scanned from 5900 to 6060

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste trabalho descrevem-se experimentos realizados em uma Lmpada de Catodo Oco de Urnio com Descarga Pulsada, usada com o objetivo de se obter uma fonte de vapor metlico para uso em espectroscopia de fotoionizao. O vapor de urnio gerado por uma descarga eltrica pulsada, e medidas de corrente eltrica so realizadas no ps-descarga (afterglow). ons de urnio so produzidos usando um esquema de fotoionizao por absoro seqencial de trs ftons de dois comprimentos de onda, gerados por lasers de corante bombeados por lasers de vapor de cobre. Dos resultados experimentais foi observado que aproximadamente 17% dos tomos no estado fundamental podem ser ionizados num nico pulso de laser e que h uma forte evidncia de formao de aglomerados dentro da regio de catodo oco.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Instituto de Estudos Avanados (IEAv) do Centro Tcnico Aeroespacial (CTA) vem desenvolvendo, desde sua fundao, em 1981, estudos e experimentos sobre separao de istopos de urnio por lasers. Neste trabalho so descritos os princpios fundamentais dos mtodos de separao por lasers e mostrado o experimento de enriquecimento de urnio utilizando lasers de corante bombeados por lasers de vapor de cobre e vapor atmico de urnio metlico, atualmente em andamento no IEAv. O trabalho descrito compreende o desenvolvimento de lasers e experimentos de espectroscopia optogalvnica e de fotoionizao, visando a determinao de sees de choque e de desvios isotpicos do urnio, alm de experimentos de separao propriamente ditos.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present a dye laser preamplifier pumped by copper vapor laserthat uses fiber optic beam delivery device as system to pumping and injecting power to be amplified. In high-gain device, particularly under strong pumping conditions, considerations about amplified spontaneous emission are of fundamental importance to optimize the operation characteristics of the dye oscillator-amplifier system. Furthermore, the amplified spontaneous emission can spoil the spectral width of dye laser system lowering the selectivity in uranium atomic vapor laser isotope separation process. Hence, these beam delivery devices can improve the stability and flexibility of the alignment as well as eliminate the amplified spontaneous emission. An appropriate fiber length avoids the coupling of the amplified spontaneous emission into dye oscillator. Besides that, due to its small diameter, the fiber also works as a spatial filter and helps to reduce the amplified spontaneous emission.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper describes the experimental investigation of the effects of electric fields on autoionizing states of uranium using a pulsed hollow cathode lamp illuminated by a pulsed dye laser. With the laser tuned near the single-photon transition around 5915 , a single-frequency, multi-photon ionization signal has been observed, and this signal has been used to monitor the ground-state uranium vapor density in the afterglow of the pulsed-discharge lamp. The photoionization signal has then been measured as function of the lamp bias voltage, and the decrease in the photoionization signal with increasing bias voltage has been attributed to a spectral broadening due to Stark effect.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The hollow cathode glow discharge is a good source of metal atoms and ions, which has been used in several technological applications, especially, in the processes of the thin film deposition, and as light source for spectroscopy and laser devices. A full characterization of the discharge requires information on several plasma constituents as, e.g., the density of sputtered metal atoms and ions, the density of gas atoms, metastable and ions, and the electron temperature which are usually hardly available. The hollow cathode lamp is a very versatile, compact, simple and reliable tool to provide metal vapor for spectroscopic purposes. It basically consists on a hollow cathode electric discharge cell with optical windows to allow the passage of light either from the discharge to the outside or from an external light source into the discharge region. Collisions of discharge ions with cathode walls can provide a dense vapor of the cathode material. One important application for the hollow cathode lamp is the optogalvanic spectroscopy. For multistep photoionization spectroscopy, however, the optogalvanic spectroscopy technique presents some inconveniences due to collision between electrons and highly excited atoms which can be more effective than photoionization. This paper describes the assessment of a pulsed hollow cathode lamp for photoionization spectroscopy. The hollow cathode lamp is driven by an electric circuit that pulses the discharge and allows electric current measurements in the afterglow. Ions of uranium were produced through sequential absorption of three photons from tunable dye lasers pumped by copper vapor lasers. The signal decaytime was attributed to the uranium ions diffusion toward the cathode walls while the ion diffusion time gives an insight about the gas/vapor temperature evolution in the afterglow.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Dye Laser pumped by Copper Vapor Laser operates at high repetition rate and its application has been spread to many fields such as medical, multistep photoionization spectroscopy, and isotope separation. For laser oscillators, it is generally valid to say that, the higher the output power the more difficult is to control spectral characteristics and beam quality. Spectral characteristics are controlled by dispersive optical placed inside the laser resonator. The low damage threshold of these components virtually forbids their use in high power systems. So, when tunability and spectral purity at high power are desired, it is recommended to have a low power oscillator, that determines the spectral characteristics of the beam, followed by power amplifiers. This configures a typical Master Oscillator Power Amplifier (MOPA) chain. In our case, the dye MOPA chain consist of three amplifiers in series. The first amplifier in the chain works as high-gain preamplifier to generate sufficient input power to saturate the following amplifier units. In high-gain device, particularly under strong pumping conditions, considerations about amplified spontaneous emission (ASE) are of fundamental importance to optimize the characteristics of operation of the dye oscillator-amplifier system. The ASE can spoil the spectral width of dye laser system. Furthermore, the use of beam deliveries based on fiber-optics can improve the stability and flexibility of the alignment as well as eliminate the ASE. An appropriate fiber length avoid the ASE generated to be coupled into previous stage. Besides that, due its small diameter, the fiber also works as a spatial filter and helps to reduce the ASE. In this paper, we present the result obtained in scaling a dye laser preamplifier and first dye amplifier pumped by copper vapor laser through fiber optic beam deliveries. The best pump power to be used to keep the spectral characteristics under control

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: DYE LASER AMPLIFIER SYSTEM PUMPED BY COPPER VAPOR LASER USING FIBER OPTIC BEAM DELIVERY FOR BOTH PUMPING AND INJECTION

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricao de Equipamentos de Instrumentao Mdico-Hospitalares, Instrumentos de Preciso e pticos, Equipamentos Para Automao Industrial, Cronmetros e Relgios

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present a dye laser amplifier system pumped by copper vapor laser that uses fiber optic beam delivery device for pumping and injecting the power to be amplified. In high-gain devices, particularly under strong pumping conditions, considerations about amplified spontaneous emission are of fundamental importance to optimize the operation characteristics. Furthermore, the amplified spontaneous emission can spoil the spectral width of dye laser system lowering the selectivity in the uranium atomic vapor laser isotope separation process. Hence, these beam delivery devices can improve the stability and flexibility of the alignment as well as eliminate the amplified spontaneous emission. An appropriate fiber length avoids the coupling of the amplified spontaneous emission into the dye oscillator. Besides that, due to its small diameter, the fiber also works as a spatial filter and helps to reduce the amplified spontaneous emission. Fiber-optic beam delivery systems are replacing conventional mirror systems because their flexibility, stability and easy alignment. Commercial products are available that use fiber optic delivery for laser surgery and materials processing. Many laser wavelengths have been transported through optical fiber and high power delivery has been reported for argon, Nd:YAG, and excimer lasers. However, few papers have been published about fiber optical beam delivery systems in a visible range, in special for dye laser amplifiers pumped by copper vapor lasers. Although the fiber optic spoils the laser mode and the laser beam divergence, it improves the laser power distributions. Concluding we can say that this fiber-optic beam deliver is very convenient to transport the optical beam, to improves the optic flexibility and alignment stability and to reduce the ASE to a typical MOPA configuration used to AVLIS purpose.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Atomic Vapor Laser Isotope Separation project, AVLIS, in development in the Instituto de Estudos Avan\c cados, IEAv, demands extensive studies of multi-step, multi-frequencies photoionization spectroscopy in metallic U. These studies have been done using natural Uranium hollow cathode lamp at IEAv. The hollow cathode lamp is a very versatile, compact, simple and reliable tool to provide metal vapor for spectroscopic purposes. One of the most important application for the hollow cathode lamp is the optogalvanic spectroscopy. For multistep photoionization spectroscopy, however, the optogalvanic spectroscopy technique presents some inconveniences due to collisions with electrons. The ionization due to collision between electrons and highly excited atoms may be more effective than photoionization, and the optogalvanic signal that comes from absorption may not be distinguished from the signal that comes from these collisions. Moreover, superelastic collisions induce relaxation of excited atoms, competing with ionization processes. The effect of collisions with electrons can be avoided if the discharge is eliminated during photoionization experiments, i.e., using a pulsed hollow cathode lamp and performing the experiments in the afterglow. An high-resolution spectroscopy required for AVLIS is the hyperfine structure. An atom whose nucleus has an even number of protons and neutrons has no nuclear spin, but an atom with an odd number has a non-zero nuclear spin. For example, $^{238}$U has a 0 nuclear spin, whereas $^{235}$U has 7/2. This presents paper describes hyperfine structure and isotope shift measured between the $^{238}$U line and the center of gravity of the $^{235}$U components in a natural uranium hollow cathode lamp. The photoionization spectroscopy was obtained using a dye laser tuned near the uranium single-photon transition around 591,5 nm.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The hollow cathode lamp is a very versatile, compact, simple and reliable tool to provide metal vapor for spectroscopic purposes. One of the most important application for the hollow cathode lamp is the optogalvanic spectroscopy. For multistep photoionization spectroscopy, however, the optogalvanic spectroscopy technique presents some inconveniences due to collisions with electrons. The ionization due to collision between electrons and highly excited atoms may be more effective than photoionization, and the optogalvanic signal that comes from absorption may not be distinguished from the signal that comes from these collisions. More over, superelastic collisions induce relaxation of excited atoms, competing with ionization processes. The effect of collisions with electrons can be avoided if the discharge is eliminated during photoionization experiments, i.e., using a pulsed hollow cathode lamp and performing the experiments in the afterglow. In a previous paper we described the assessment of a pulsed hollow cathode lamp for photoionization spectroscopy. The hollow cathode lamp was driven by an electric circuit that pulsed the discharge and allowed electric current measurements in the afterglow. To assess such a setup, ions were produced by using a well known multistep photoionization scheme for uranium excited by tunable dye lasers. Photoionization signals were obtained and their amplitudes were measured along the afterglow period. The time behavior of these individual electric signals, observed in our experiences, basically is determined by diffusion. The abrupt build up of the signal can be attributed to the collection of electrons produced in the photoionisation process while that the slow decline of the signal indicates the collection of ions. This time of diffusion of ions has been used to measure of the diffusion coefficient and mobility of uranium ions in argon.

This time of diffusion of ions was used to measure and monitor the gas/vapor temperature evolution in the afterglow of a pulsed hollow cathode lamp.

We are starting to work with Ytterbium, Erbium, Dysprosium and Neodymium laser selective photoionization research. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: LASER TECHNIQUES APPLIED TO ISOTOPE SEPARATION OF URANIUM

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Espectros Atmicos e Integrao de Ftons

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Converso, Enriquecimento e Fabricao de Combustvel Nuclear

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Several countries that utilize nuclear energy around the world are significantly investing in developing laser techniques applied to isotope separation. In Brazil these studies are concentrated in one research institute, the Institute for Advanced Studies (IEAv), and aim toward demonstration of the viability of this process using resources available in this country. In this paper we describe the laser methods for isotope separation, giving an overview of the present status of research and development in this area in other countries and show some results obtained in our laboratories. We focused this report on the atomic route for laser isotope separation, mainly in the areas of laser development and spectroscopy.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Aplicaes de Vcuo

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Espectros Atmicos e Integrao de Ftons

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Converso, Enriquecimento e Fabricao de Combustvel Nuclear

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Several countries that utilize nuclear energy are investing significantly in the development of laser techniques applied to isotope separation. In Brazil these studies are concentrated in one research institute, the IEAv (Institute for Advanced Studies), and aim towards demonstrating the viability of this process using, as much as possible, resources available in the country. In this paper we briefly describe the laser methods for isotope separation, giving an overview of the present research and development status in this area. We also show some results obtained in our laboratories. We focused this report on the atomic route for laser isotope separation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: CLUSTER FORMATION AND URANIUM PHOTOIONIZATION IN THE AFTERGLOW OF A PULSED HOLLOW CATHODE LAMP

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Processos de Coliso e Interaes de tomos e Molculas

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Converso, Enriquecimento e Fabricao de Combustvel Nuclear

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Uranium photoionization has been observed in the afterglow of pulsed hollow cathode lamps illuminated by a dye laser tuned near the electronic transition around 591.5 nm nm (5L06 0 - 16,900 cm-1 7M7). . The photoionization signal was used to monitor the time evolution of the ground state uranium vapor density in the cathode hole. Lifetimes over 1 ms have been measured for the uranium vapor; that makes this device attractive for multi-step photoionization spectroscopy. The obtained results lead to the conclusion that these long times are due to cluster formation in the afterglow.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: SMALL-SIGNAL GAIN AND SATURATION INTENSITY IN DYE LASER AMPLIFIERS

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: reas Clssicas de Fenomenologia e suas Aplicaes

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricao de Equipamentos de Instrumentao Mdico-Hospitalares, Instrumentos de Preciso e pticos, Equipamentos Para Automao Industrial, Cronmetros e Relgios

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Small-signal gain and saturation intensity are obtained from input and output intensity measurements in a dye amplifier stage in which amplified spontaneous emission changes the amplifier performance. We demonstrate that these measurements lead to more accurate values for the effective gain of the amplifier that what can be obtained from theoretical calculations by using physical parameters of the dye. Furthernore, this method can be used to optimize de power extraction efficiency for a dye amplifier stage transversely pumped by a copper vapor laser.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste trabalho descrevem-se experimentos realizados em uma Lampada de Catodo Oco de Uranio com Descarga Pulsada, usada com o objetivo de se obter uma fonte de .vapor metalico para uso em espectroscopia de fotoionizacao. O vapor de uranio e gerado por uma descarga eletrica pulsada, e medidas de corrente eletrica sao realizadas no pos-descarga (afterglow). Ions de uranio sao produzidos usando um esquema de fotoionizacao por absorcao sequencial de tres fotons de dois comprimentos de onda; gerados por laseres de corante bombeados por laseres de vapor de cobre. Dos resultados experimentais foi observado que ha uma forte evidencia de formacao de aglomerados dentro da regiao de catodo oco.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the experimental investigation of the effective lifetime of the 7M7 uranium level in a hollow cathode lamp, with two different methods of population probing: using the optogalvanic signal in a DC discharge and using the photoionization signal in the afterglow of a pulsed discharge.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Espectros Atmicos e Integrao de Ftons

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The observation of current in the afterglow of the discharge in a pulsed hollow-cathode lamp illuminated by tunable lasers, combined with optogalvanic techniques, provides a simple and reliable tool for multi-step photoionization spectroscopy studies. A three-photon photoionization spectroscopy study was performed in a uranium hollow-cathode lamp, using this combination of techniques. Single-, double- and triple-frequency photoionization paths were identified for uranium, in the range between 5900 and 6060 .

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the results of Doppler-limited optogalvanic spectroscopy in commercial neodymium hollow cathode lamp, ranging from 580 to 600 nm. Using the laser multistep excitation technique, five transitions for the first step excitation from the neodymium ground state and seven transitions related to the second step of photoionization scheme were observed. Within these results, for the first time, a new line, 596.645 nm, was observed which could be attributed to a possible two-step transition to neodymium energy level from the 16979.352 cm−1 to 33 735.4 cm−1. The simulated (synthetic) spectra of a mixture of neon (Ne I) and neodymium (Nd I) in this region are compared with experiments in order to facilitate data analysis.

We report a software for aquisition and mathematical treatment of data. A t603 Tektronix Oscilloscope with a 7D20 programmable digitizer drawer interfaced with an IBM-PC copatible microcomputer through a STD-8410 plate, via GPIB interface was used. The software was developed usind the Turbo Pascal 6.0 language.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricao de Equipamentos de Instrumentao Mdico-Hospitalares, Instrumentos de Preciso e pticos, Equipamentos Para Automao Industrial, Cronmetros e Relgios

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Patente de inveno de dispositivo constitudo por uma pina mecnica para ser utilizada na fixao de fibra ptica, outros cabos ou fios delicados, em conectores comerciais de fibras para eliminar a utilizao de adesivos em geral. O carter de novidade deste dispositivo a possibilidade de fixao de fibra ptica em conectores de fibras ptica comerciais, j existentes, sem a necessidade de utilizao de colas ou adesivos em geral para a fixao da fibra no conector. Esta possibilidade particularmente til no uso de tais conectores em laboratrios de pesquisas onde as fixaes das fibras, em geral, so provisrias ou necessitam de constantes modificaes. O dispositivo em questo permite a reutilizao dos conectores, sem a necessidade de limpeza e desobstruo dos mesmo, na ocasio de reparo na extremidade da fibra. Ele permite, tambm, a possibilidade de fixao de quaisquer cabos ou fios delicados aos conectores comerciais de fibras.
